alert.note: Alert for Adams; Boise; Camas; Elmore; Valley; Washington (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 27 at 11:23AM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...SNOWMELT WILL CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK RESULTING IN RISING WATER LEVELS ON CREEKS, STREAMS, AND RIVERS... The sharp warmup this weekend will increase snowmelt and therefore the flooding risk into next week. Sheet flooding from snowmelt could impact locations in higher elevation valleys that still hold a snowpack, including the Camas Prairie. Current river forecasts keep most mainstem rivers below flood stage, but people with interests along these rivers should remain aware as forecasts will change as the scope of melting comes into focus. If there is deep snow in your area, clear snow, ice and debris from culverts and other flow paths to allow runoff to flow away from buildings and other vulnerable infrastructure. Move deep snow away from the foundations of buildings and move equipment, and livestock out of poorly drained or low lying areas. Stay tuned to the latest hydrologic forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Boise; Camas; Elmore; Valley; Washington
